reviewText: I remember this program from when I was a child.  I was impressed then and I still am now.  This may not be everyone's cup of tea, but if you are looking for a good old time you may enjoy this one.
summary: The first in a long list of medical dramas
Title: N/A

reviewText: Medic is an example of a golden age of TV that was primitive, yet packed with powerful drama and characters. No tricks, just classic drama, and all in a living, faded, black and white picture. Medic's gripping stories sometimes leave you with a heavy heart because the world of medicine does not always lead to a happy ending. These are real stories about real people suffering the real "slings and arrows of outrageous fortune" one moment and the miracles of gut-wrenching medical procedures the next. Richard Boone shows the great talent that was to develop in later years. He died too soon at sixty-three. For me, Victor Young's "Medic Theme" will always be one of my favorite screen melodies. Powerful stuff and worthy of the drama it underscores with soaring beauty. Add Medic to your library to learn how much  sincere artists achieved with so little. As Shakespeare said: "The play's the thing...." With Medic you don't need or miss "special effects." Even today's sophisticated viewers, escept for the truly jaded, will enjoy most of these episodes. Recommended highly!

reviewText: Medic.This series I bought sight unseen because of Richard Boone.I then found out it was created by James E Moser who would later go on to create "Ben Casey".I really liked that show.It was my favourite medical show of all.There was 59 episodes made but Timeless Media Group have managed to get their hands on only 44 episodes.This is a great series,gripping ,harrowing,enlightning,entertaining and realistic as most of the shows are taken from actual files.What this series does is go into detail about the patients and the ailments and procedures.It plays almost like a documentary.It may feel a bit static as this was early TV and there were limited camera movements and sets.But actual operations on camera as well making us think about how our organs work so hard inside us to keep us living is amazing.There are a few young actors in it that would go onto greater things and become household names like John Saxon,Dennis Hopper to name two.This series shows how things have changed as in one episode that starred Lee J Cobb which deals with electric-shock treatment which we now know has been banned from practice.There are some flecks and specs on the film but that did not upset my viewing pleasure.A great series in my opinion.Thanks Timeless Media Group for releasing this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Richard Boone is both narrator and participant in some of these episodes.  The historical background given by Boone in the opening scenes is brief and to the point so that you can be taken to the scene of the action quickly and efficiently.This series is a fine snapshot of medical practices of the 1950s which might seem outmoded now.  Electro-convulsive therapy is shown as a treatment practice in the '50s.  The effects of a nuclear bomb explosion are graphic and chilling to watch and listen to.  The open heart valve replacement is quite intriguing even in black and white.  Overall this is a series that while it might seem to be somewhat dated is good for historical background and comparison with the way medicine is practiced now.Growing up in the 1950s this was the state of medicine as I knew it and it seemed pretty impressive.  I recommend this to anyone with an interest in medical history.
summary: Excellent depiction of medical practices of the 1950s

reviewText: First and most important I must share that about 58 episodes of MEDIC were produced so this 44 episode set is NOT the complete series so I take off one star of what would have been an easy five star rating if you like old medical dramas. I'm not sure if other copies of MEDIC available on AMAZON.com  include missing episodes but I am buying them to find out. IF I find any missing episodes of MEDIC in these other offerings I'll update this review with that information if I can.I am happy I brought this MEDIC DVD for what would likely be considered all the wrong reasons. MEDIC is most known to be a military term on one who is versed in the medical arts in some form.  Usually battlefield medical personnel of some type are called Medic.  Yet the term MEDIC for which this series is named has no overt military connection. Despite the beautiful picture of LA County General Hospital being used as a backdrop on the cover, many hospital locales are used or suggested in this MEDIC series.MEDIC is a series where most of the wood is in the acting.  I have never seen so much totally wooden acting in my life.  The VOICE OF GOD, narration style also makes the entire MEDIC series feel like one of those government army propoganda films or worse one of those health films from the 1950's.  None of this is meant to say don't buy MEDIC because; watching this stuff is hilarious. Watching the episode where a man's heavy Sweedish accent comes and goes had me on the floor laughing so hard I cried tears.Huge issue with MEDIC is sound quality or the complete lack thereof.  There is an all too noticable darn near constant hiss during all the programs. The sound of the hiss is so annoying. The hiss sound in the background is not unlike having your own private water fall hidden somewhere in every scene.  The hiss can't easily be ignored but with practice you hear it less.  The stilted 1950's wholesome dialogue is very much in evidence here. MEDIC is so completely censored that you could easily think the positively reckless shiftless censors for Dr. Kildaire was Caligula himself.  In MEDIC ladies looked down in modesty when talking to men folk.  Ladies were sheepish or fawn like. Some of the men came off as total dweebs.  the video quality is a 4 on the one to five scale.  Some episodes being better or worse than others but the vodeo quality is pretty good overall.  No dark areas, artifacts, hair or fuzz on the screen, no projector noise the constant hiss background sound effectively blocks it all out. No over exposed too bright white out in the video.  The video is almost first rate which makes MEDIC watchable despite the constant hiss sound.All in all MEDIC is fun to watch in that Mystery Science Theatre 3000 sort of way. The bots would have a field day tearing new ones in these wooden actors with their sugary sickeningly sweet their pastey dialogue.  MEDIC reminds me of Reefer Madness in the portrayal of bad people who have abandoned wholesome virtue. If you put the Leave It To Beaver in a hospital setting you'd have MEDIC which is why its so funny.I did not think I remembered seeing reruns of MEDIC growing up. I only remembered MEDIC after seeing its opening. So yes I did see MEDIC in reruns as a very young child. I remember the snake crawing up the staff in the opening because; seeing that frightened me. The whole snake crawling up the staff seemed aweful creepy and not in a good way.  In MEDIC so far the death toll of lost patients is not that high.  Patients die on the operating table sometimes but they are brought back. MEDIC exists before the idea of defibelation was in wide use.  When your heart stopped on the table they massaged your heart hoping it restarted.  No adrelilan no calcuim carbonate, no crash cart, none of the normal things you see in todays medical dramas when hearts stop beating.That said MEDIC surgeries look a whole lot more convincing and realistic. The doctors behaviors and use of that era's primative instruments in and out of surgery seems far more relaistic \ natural and not rehersed at all. The most shocking thing about MEDIC is how primative the technology of the day looks even to lay people with no medical background whatsoever.  When the treatment for a blocked heart valve was to open the heart so the dictor could poke his finger in the valve to release its flaps I darn near died laughing. We all know today a bad valve would be replaced by a pig's valve or some weird plastic thing.Today after 50 plus years going to hospitals for my 13 disabilities MEDIC is fun to watch nothing I see there scares me now. MEDIC is an interesting case study in both our medical history and cultural evolution. MEDIC is worth its price on the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 cheezyness of the dialogue and wooden acting alone.  When MEDIC was written the treatments were state of the art.  When MEDIC was written the dry stiff people and painfully scripted dialogue was how all so called "good people" were expected to behave. MEDIC made me laugh so hard, I think if you don't buy this and you enjoyed Mystery Science Theatre 3000 you do yourself an almost criminal dis-service not buying this. Trust me watching MEDIC will wake up your inner wise-cracking systems and they will promptly run amuk. MEDIC is a target rich environment for people who liked Mystery Sicence Theatre 3000.  You want to have some real fun.  Put on a MEDIC DVD and get together a few of your most insane friends who see humor in everything. I promise you the laughter won't stop, even if you might want it too. I'm so happy IO brought this MEDIC set of DVD's because there are times in my life I need a good laugh! ;)
summary: GREAT SHOW LIKE A MEDICAL FILM NOIR - THE MOST WOODEN ACTING I'VE EVER SEEN ANYWHERE - SO FUNNY!
